responses.rationale: Reports numerical metrics ('two more farms', '5.3 million hens', '88,000 turkeys') using standard verbs ('infected', 'forcing the killing') without vivid language.
Reports numerical metrics ('22 million birds', '1.8 million broiler chickens', etc.) using standard verbs ('mean', 'have had to kill') without vivid language.
Reports numerical metrics ('13 million chickens', '305,000 turkeys') using standard verbs ('accounts for', 'having to kill') without vivid language.
Reports numerical metrics ('46 million chickens') using standard verbs ('is', 'had') without vivid language.
Reports numerical metrics ('11.7 million turkeys') using standard verb ('raises') without vivid language.
The segment reports locations of cases, not primarily prices, economic data, or numerical metrics in the Q9 sense.
Reports numerical metrics ('35,500 birds') using standard verb ('confirmed') without vivid language.
Reports numerical metrics ('23 states') using standard verbs ('shows', 'have confirmed') without vivid language.
The segment describes the cause of spread, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
